spanGrp.span: The mourning dove and hummingbird's wedding party

publicationStmt.p: This is an XML-TEI markup of the original publications by SIL Mexico for the purposes of: archival and for the creation of a body of Mixtepec-Mixtec language resources (LR) (ISO: mix). Encoded documents used with the permission of original authors.

notesStmt.note: Una tortolita se quería casar con el colibrí, pero no tenía dinero para la fiesta. Así que todos los pájaros le ayudaron con algo para la boda.

sourceDesc.bibl: Viko tanta'a lakuku tsi ncho'o Ramos Hernández, Herminia; Beckmann, Gisela Nieves, María M.. 2008. (2nd ed.).Instituto Lingüístico de Verano, A.C. Tlalpan, D.F., México Obtained from:

textDesc.channel: @mode:'w' means that the primary means of utilising this document is by reading it's written form;
textDesc.derivation: this document is labeled "original" because the XML-TEI markup of it's contents have not made any alterations to the original content;

normalization.ab: 2018-03-10Spelling of lexical items which in the old orthography were homographs and which have been changed according to updated orthographic principles as per ../Mille/GUIA_ORTOGRAFICA_PRELIMINAR_Short_version.xml. Instances of "ña" still remain to be changed pending consultation with Mille (or other person working on orthography).

list.item: Mixtec content found at following locations: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg/w

English translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalentwhere a preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

Spanish translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalent where a preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

spanGrp.span: One day there was a mourning dove that wanted to get married to a hummingbird but he had no money to have a party.
Un día una tortolita quiería casarse con un colibrí pero no tenía dinero para tener una fiesta.
note the phrase: "sa'a in viko" 'to have a party' (literally: make a party)
Then it was worried about how to make it happen and then began to cry while sitting there.
Pues se preocupaba de como podría hacerlo, y empezo a llorar sentado allí.
Then the birds arrived at the small woods and then they asked him:
Pues llegaron los pájaros al pequeño bosque y le preguntaron:
I'm crying because I really want to get married but there is no money.
Estoy llorando porque quiero realmente casarme pero no hay dinero.
Then the small birds said the following:
Y los pájarito dijeron el siguente:
Don't cry, all of us will help you, then you'll get married so that you can live well.
No llores, todos nosotro te ayudaramos, pues te casas para que puedes vivir bien.
"koo va'a" 'live well' (what is "koo" here? is it the same as 'not be/without'?)
I can give clothes clothes, the bride will get married with shoes.
Puedo dar ropas, la novia se casará con zapatos.
I will give them something to drink and food to eat.
Yo les voy a dar bebida y alimentos.
I will give clothes for the groom to get married in.
Yo puedo dar ropas para el novio.
I will give a hat for the groom to get married in.
Yo puedo dar un sombrero para el novio.
I will give shoes for the groom to get married in.
Yo puedo dar zapatos para el novio.
I can give a nest for them to get married in.
Yo puedo les dar un nido para casarse.
I will be the groom's sponsor.
I can be the bride's sponsor.
There the mourning dove became very happy and then was able to get married.
Allí la tortolita se puso muy feliz y pues podía casarse.
And then the mourning dove lived hapily with the hummingbird and all the little birds were happy as well.
Y la tortolita vivió felizmente con el colibrí y todos los pájaros pequeños se sentiron feliz en la misma manera.
